The 'Schutzstaffel' (, translated to Protection Squadron or defence corps,
abbreviated 'SS'âor with stylized "Armanen" ''sig'' runes) was a major
paramilitary organization under Adolf Hitler and the Nazi Party (NSDAP). It
began at the end of 1920 as a small, permanent guard unit known as the "Saal-
Schutz" (Hall-Protection) Lumsden, Robin. A Collector's Guide To: The
WaffenâSS, Ian Allan Publishing, Inc. p. 7. made up of NSDAP volunteers to
provide security for Nazi Party meetings in Munich. Later in 1925, Heinrich
Himmler joined the unit which had by then been reformed and renamed the "Schutz-
Staffel". Under Himmler's leadership (1929â45), it grew from a small
paramilitary formation to one of the largest and most powerful organizations in
the Third Reich. Lumsden, Robin. A Collector's Guide To: The Allgemeine-SS,
Ian Allan Publishing, Inc. p. 16. Built upon the Nazi ideology, the SS
under Himmler's command was responsible for many of the crimes against humanity
during World War II (1939â45). The SS, along with the Nazi Party, was
banned in Germany as a criminal organization after 1945.
headings: After the Nazi seizure of power
